channel.title: Favorite Vacation?
channel.description: Pretty self-explanatory. What is your favorite vacation? Mine has to be one of the cruises I have been on to places like Cancun.

item.title: Favorite Vacation?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:32, topic:440031”]The coolest vacation I’ve ever been on, hands down, is a road trip to Yellowstone National Park my wife and I went on when we were dating. It seriously looks (and smells!) like you are on a different planet when you get there, and each and every natural phenomenon you see is beautiful and completely different from all of the others. Some of the water and springs there reach 400 degrees F, but doesn’t boil due to weird pressure factors and stuff.

And that’s just the geological stuff. There are also vast amounts of really neat native wildlife, pronghorn antelope, buffalo, elk, and others, all of which are a common sight. Also a few you DON’T want to see, like Grizzly Bear, and mountain lion.

Also, even though the temperature gets very warm to hot there in the summer, the nights are cold, and yellowstone lake, being so high up, generally stays around 40-50 F even in the summer, so even in the heat of august, if you fall out of a boat on the lake, you have something like 3-5 minutes before hypothermia sets in.

Anyway, the road trip there from Ohio was amazing too, seeing all the sites along the way, we also dropped by Mt. Rushmore on the way back, and that was pretty neat too.

So, go on a road trip to Yellowstone. :)[/quote]Dude I live so close to that park :o

Read full topic

item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I have a fear of drowning. So I stay away from water as much as possible.
[/quote]

I understand your phobia, but if you ever get a chance to go on a cruise. Nothing beats them[/quote]

was joking about this:

frozon566:

I have Thalassophobia, Kinetophobia(if its severe), Acrophobia & fear of avalanches(is there a word for this?) so I don’t enjoy vacations much.

everyone is afraid of drowning

Also, even though the temperature gets very warm to hot there in the summer, the nights are cold, and yellowstone lake, being so high up, generally stays around 40-50 F even in the summer, so even in the heat of august, if you fall out of a boat on the lake, you have something like 3-5 minutes before hypothermia sets in.

item.title: Favorite Vacation?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The coolest vacation I’ve ever been on, hands down, is a road trip to Yellowstone National Park my wife and I went on when we were dating. It seriously looks (and smells!) like you are on a different planet when you get there, and each and every natural phenomenon you see is beautiful and completely different from all of the others. Some of the water and springs there reach 400 degrees F, but doesn’t boil due to weird pressure factors and stuff.

And that’s just the geological stuff. There are also vast amounts of really neat native wildlife, pronghorn antelope, buffalo, elk, and others, all of which are a common sight. Also a few you DON’T want to see, like Grizzly Bear, and mountain lion.

Also, even though the temperature gets very warm to hot there in the summer, the nights are cold, and yellowstone lake, being so high up, generally stays around 40-50 F even in the summer, so even in the heat of august, if you fall out of a boat on the lake, you have something like 3-5 minutes before hypothermia sets in.

Anyway, the road trip there from Ohio was amazing too, seeing all the sites along the way, we also dropped by Mt. Rushmore on the way back, and that was pretty neat too.

So, go on a road trip to Yellowstone.

Read full topic

@nolan2131 wrote:

Lol, reminds me of when I went canoeing in Tennessee like class 2 or 3 and the guide hit a rock that was hidden under some rapids on purpose. I unfortunately was at the front of the boat and got halfway tossed in as my brother grabbed me. A boat about a quarter of a mile upstream got my paddle
